alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 27 at 5:25AM CST until February 27 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Freezing Rain This Morning... .Freezing rain is quickly surging northeast across the area early this morning, and will move north of highway 29 in north-central Wisconsin before 7 am. Untreated surfaces, including roads and sidewalks, will quickly accrue ice. Warmer air is also moving north, which will help limit the amount of freezing rain that will impact a location. Currently, warmer air is expected to reach the I-94 corridor by 8 am. Additional icing should end there, but surfaces could still be icy. North of there, freezing rain could persist for most of the morning. There will be a change over to snow for the afternoon north of highway 29 in north-central Wisconsin, with 1 to 2 inch accumulations. Temperatures will play a key role in icing amounts. Small changes could result in substantial shifts in impacts. Pay close attention to the forecast for any revisions. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain with icing up to 1/4 inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Jackson County. * WHEN...Until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions. Power outages and tree damage possible.The morning commute will be impacted.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
